title: Calories in 1/2 Cup 2 Percent Milk
meta_description: Discover calories in 1/2 cup 2 percent milk, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and simple variations for your diet.
assumptions: Reduced-fat (2%) cow's milk, pasteurized, fortified with vitamins A and D; 1 cup = 244 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fat content, fortification, and processing; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 1/2 cup of 2% milk provides about 61 kcal and 4g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup 2 percent milk?
faqs.a: Approximately 61 kcal for 1/2 cup (122 g) of 2% milk.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1/2 cup 2% milk?
faqs.a: About 4 g of protein per 1/2 cup serving.

faqs.q: Does 2% milk have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: No, just 2.4 g total fat in 1/2 cup, with 1.6 g saturated.

faqs.q: How do calories compare to whole milk for 1/2 cup?
faqs.a: Whole milk has about 91 kcal per 1/2 cup, 30 more than 2%.

faqs.q: Is there fiber or carbs in 2% milk?
faqs.a: 0 g fiber and 5.9 g carbs (mostly lactose sugars) per 1/2 cup.
